meanings.definition: To convert into or express in the form of currency.
meanings.sent1: She monetized her artwork by selling it at the local market.
meanings.sent2: The company monetized its online platform by offering premium subscriptions.
meanings.sent3: The idea of monetizing a lemonade stand in winter seemed silly but creative.
meanings.sent4: His talent for monetizing opportunities turned him into a successful entrepreneur.
meanings.sent5: The concept of monetizing time as a valuable resource resonated with her.

meanings.definition: To make money from (an asset, business, etc.).
meanings.sent1: They monetized their real estate investments by renting out properties.
meanings.sent2: The musician monetized his songs by licensing them for commercials.
meanings.sent3: Monetizing a backyard full of weeds became a profitable landscaping venture.
meanings.sent4: She had a knack for monetizing her hobbies and turning them into side businesses.
meanings.sent5: The artist monetized her passion for painting and started selling her artwork.

meanings.sent1: The charity monetized donations to fund their community projects.
meanings.sent2: The app developer monetized the free version by including in-app purchases.
meanings.sent3: Monetizing a blog about pet care led to unexpected financial success.
meanings.sent4: He found a way to monetize his social media following through sponsored posts.
meanings.sent5: The small business owner monetized her skills by offering online courses.
